Description: Parameters for the allometric equation (see Equation field) to estimate total aboveground biomass in Red maple (Acer rubrum)
Parameters / Conditions: Tree species: Acer rubrum; Common name: Red maple; Native name: n/a; Diameter above 2 in and below 30 in
Equation: AB = a*D^b where AB = total aboveground biomass in lb; D = diameter at breast height (1,3 m) in in; a, b = parameters (see 'Value' field).
Technical Reference: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) - Brennemann, B.B., Frederick, D.J., Gardner, W.E., Schoenhofen, L.H., and Marsh, P.L. (1978). Biomass of species and stands of West Virginia hardwoods. Pope, P.E., ed. Proceedings Central Hardwood Forest Conference II. West LaFayette, IN: Pudue Univ.; 159-178.

Description: Parameters for the allometric equation (see Equation field) to estimate total aboveground biomass in Red maple (Acer rubrum)
Parameters / Conditions: Tree species: Acer rubrum; Common name: Red maple; Native name: n/a; Diameter above 3 in and below 12 in
Equation: ln(AB) = a+b*lnD where AB = total aboveground biomass in kg; D = diameter at breast height (1,3 m) in in; a, b = parameters (see 'Value' field).
Technical Reference: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) - Bridge, J.A. (1979). Fuelwood production of mixed hardwoods on mesic sites in Rhode island. Kingston, RI: Univ. of Rhode Island; M.S. Thesis. 72p.

Description: Parameters for the allometric equation (see Equation field) to estimate total stem biomass (stem wood+stem bark) in Red maple (Acer rubrum)
Parameters / Conditions: Tree species: Acer rubrum; Common name: Red maple; Native name: ; Diameter above 4 in
Equation: ST = a+b*D where ST = total stem biomass (stem wood+stem bark) in lb; D = diameter at breast height (1,3 m) in in; a, b = parameters (see 'Value' field).
Technical Reference: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) - Dunlap, W.H., and Shipman, R.D. (1967). Density and weught prediction of standing white oak, red maple, and red pine. University Park, PA: Pennsylvania State Univ. School of For. Resour.. Res Briefs 2(3); 66-69

Description: Parameters for the allometric equation (see Equation field) to estimate total stem biomass (stem wood+stem bark) in Red maple (Acer rubrum)
Parameters / Conditions: Tree species: Acer rubrum; Common name: Red maple; Native name: ; Diameter above 0 cm and below 12 cm
Equation: ln(ST) = a+b+ln(D) where ST = total stem biomass (stem wood+stem bark) in g; D = diameter at breast height (1,3 m) in cm; a, b = parameters (see 'Value' field).
Technical Reference: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) -Goldsmith, L.J., and Hocker, H.W., Jr. (1978). Preliminary small-tree, aboveground biomass tables for five northern hardwoods. New Hampsire Agric. Exp. Stn. Res. Rep. 68. 30p.

Description: Parameters for the allometric equation (see Equation field) to estimate total stem biomass (stem wood+stem bark) + biomass of branches in Red maple (Acer rubrum)
Parameters / Conditions: Tree species: Acer rubrum; Common name: Red maple; Native name: ; Diameter above 0 cm and below 6 cm
Equation: LOG(ST+BR) = a+b*LOG(D2*H) where ST+BR = total stem biomass (stem wood+stem bark) + biomass of branches in g; D = diameter at breast height (1,3 m) in cm; H = total tree height in m; a, b = parameters (see 'Value' field).
Technical Reference: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) -Hitchcock, H.C., III (1978). Aboveground tree weight equations for hardwood seedlings and saplings. TAPPI: 61(10); 119-120

Description: Emission factor for gas well unloading

IPCC 1996 Source/Sink Category: 1A1a2 - Public Combined Heat and Power Generation (CHP)
Description: Methane emission factor for natural gas-fired power plants for combined heat and power generation.
Technologies / Practices: Large combined cycle power plants with maximum capacity from 680 MW to 3530 MW. Relatively new plants (from 2002 onwards) with high combustion efficiency.
Parameters / Conditions: Operation type: baseload units operating >70% of the year, intermediate units operating 30?70% of the year and peaking units operating <30% of the year.
Region / Regional Conditions: United States of America, North America
Technical Reference: Kristian D. Hajny, Olivia E. Salmon, Joseph Rudek, David R. Lyon, Andrew A. Stuff, Brian H. Stirm, Robert Kaeser, Cody R. Floerchinger, Stephen Conley, Mackenzie L. Smith and Paul B. Shepson. Observations of Methane Emissions from Natural Gas-Fired Power Plants. Environmental Science and Technology. 2019, 53, 8976?8984.

Description: Methane emission factor from plugged and abandoned oil and natural gas wells
Region / Regional Conditions: West Virginia, Eastern United States, Appalachian Basin
Abatement / Control Technologies: Abandoned wells that have been plugged. Those that have protective casing inside the wellbore cemented to the surface have to be vented in this state
Technical Reference: Riddick, S. N. Et al. (2019) Measuring methane emissions from abandoned and active oil and gas wells in West Virginia, Science of the Total Environment, 651, 1849-1956, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.scitotenv.2018.10.082

Description: Methane emission factor from unplugged and abandoned oil and natural gas wells
Region / Regional Conditions: West Virginia, Eastern United States, Appalachian Basin
Abatement / Control Technologies: Abandoned wells not plugged according to regulation
Technical Reference: Riddick, S. N. Et al. (2019) Measuring methane emissions from abandoned and active oil and gas wells in West Virginia, Science of the Total Environment, 651, 1849-1956, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.scitotenv.2018.10.082

Description: Methane emission factor from active oil and natural gas wells
Region / Regional Conditions: West Virginia, Eastern United States, Appalachian Basin
Abatement / Control Technologies: Active conventional wells in West Virginia, USA. Does not specify if venting or flaring, assume both
Technical Reference: Riddick, S. N. Et al. (2019) Measuring methane emissions from abandoned and active oil and gas wells in West Virginia, Science of the Total Environment, 651, 1849-1956, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.scitotenv.2018.10.082

Parameters / Conditions: Vegetation/crop type/subtype: Trees, broadleaf, deciduous or with dominant deciduous component ; Species: mature oak-hickory forest. The canopy is dominated by white oak (Quercus alba), northern red oak (Quercus rubra), black oak (Quercus velutina), shagbark hickory (Carya ovata) and pignut hickory (Carya glabra). Description: methane conversion factor for vermifiltration applied to dairy liquid manure
Technologies / Practices: Vermifiltration. Vermifiltration is a predominently aerobic treeatment technology for liquid manure. The technology is used to treat any liquid waste with organic loads. It is als used for food industry (wine, beer, juces, canned fuit and vegetables) sanitary swaste, acquaculture and slaughterhouses.
Parameters / Conditions: Measured in a typical dairy in California, USA
Region / Regional Conditions: Temperate region (California, USA, in 16 deg C annual mean temperature)
Abatement / Control Technologies: Vermifiltration of liquid manure can be a valid alternative to anaerobic storage (such as uncovered anaerobic lagoons).
Equation: equation 10.23 CH4 emissions for manure management, Table 10.17 in chapter 10, volume 4 of IPCC 2006 guidelines/2019 refinement
Technical Reference: Dore, S., Deverel, S. J., & Christen, N. (2022). A vermifiltration system for low methane emissions and high nutrient removal at a California dairy. Bioresource Technology Reports, 18, 101044. For general ino about vermifiltration: DOI:10.1016/j.crgsc.2021.100061
Data provider: Sabina Dore, United States of America

Parameters / Conditions: Measured in a typical dairy in California, USA and Yakima county Washington State
Region / Regional Conditions: Temperate region (California, USA, in 16 deg C annual mean temperature and Yakima WA 12 decree C.
Abatement / Control Technologies: Vermifiltration
Equation: EQUATION 10.25 for manure management, table 10.21 in chapter 10, volume 4 of IPCC 2006 guidelines/2019 refinement
Technical Reference: Lai, E., Hess, M. and Mitloehner, F.M., 2018. Profiling of the microbiome associated with nitrogen removal during vermifiltration of wastewater from a commercial dairy. Frontiers in microbiology, 9, p.1964. and Miito, G.J., Ndegwa, P.M., Alege, F.P., Coulibaly, S.S. and Harrison, J., 2022. Efficacy of a vermifilter at mitigating greenhouse gases and ammonia emissions from dairy wastewater.
Data provider: Sabina Dore, Gilbet Miito, Ellen Lai, United States of America

Parameters / Conditions: Measured in a typical dairy in California, USA and Yakima county Washington State
Region / Regional Conditions: Temperate region (California, USA, in 16 deg C annual mean temperature and Yakima WA 12 decree C.
Abatement / Control Technologies: Vermifiltration
Unit: kg NH3-N and NOx-N/kg of N excreted by livestock
Equation: EQUATION 10.26 , Table 10.22 in chapter 10, volume 4 of IPCC 2006 guidelines/2019 refinement
Technical Reference: Lai, E., Hess, M. and Mitloehner, F.M., 2018. Profiling of the microbiome associated with nitrogen removal during vermifiltration of wastewater from a commercial dairy. Frontiers in microbiology, 9, p.1964. and Miito, G.J., Ndegwa, P.M., Alege, F.P., Coulibaly, S.S. and Harrison, J., 2022. Efficacy of a vermifilter at mitigating greenhouse gases and ammonia emissions from dairy wastewater.
Data provider: Sabina Dore, Gilbet Miito, Ellen Lai, United States of America

Description: Aboveground biomass mortality rate - net increment component
Parameters / Conditions: Vegetation/crop type/subtype: Trees, broadleaf and/or conifer, deciduous or with dominant deciduous component; Species/forest composition: Dominant canopy trees include tulip poplar (Liriodendron tulipifera), pignut, red and mockernut hickory (Carya glabra, C. ovalis and C. tomentosa), black gum (Nyssa sylvatica), white ash (Fraxinus americana), white and red oak (Quercus alba, Q. rubra), slippery elm (Ulmus rubra), and American beech (Fagus grandifolia). Prominent understory components include spicebush (Lindera benzoin), pawpaw (Asimina triloba), American hornbeam (Carpinus caroliniana), witchhazel (Hamamelis virginiana), eastern redbud (Cercis canadensis), flowering dogwood (Cornus florida), blackhaw (Viburnum prunifolium), and common serviceberry (Amelanchier arborea); Biomass attributes/age: dbh trees >= 1 cm/ 108 yrs; Soil type: Alfisol.
Region / Regional Conditions: Spatial boundaries: North America, USA, Virginia, Front Royal (geographic coordinates: 38.8935, -78.14539); Climate: ; Ecological zone: Temperate mountain system; Temperature: mean annual temperature: 12.9 degrees C; Moisture: annual precipitation: 1001 mm yr-1.
Other properties: ForC site: Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute CTFS-ForestGEO plot (ID#: 1698); ForC plot: 25.6-ha forest dynamics plot (ID#: 2227); ForC measurement ID: 13540; Date of Measurement: 2008.4-2013.4; plot size: 25.6 ha; disturbance type: No severe disturbance since 1973; variable description: Annual woody mortality--i.e., total aboveground biomass of tree stems that die. ; census level: stem (ramet); elevation: 302 m; Koeppen climate zone: Cfa.
Equation: Equation 2.18
Technical Reference: Gonzalez-Akre, E., Meakem, V., Eng, C., Tepley, A. J., Bourg, N. A., McShea, W., ... Anderson-Teixeira, K. (2016). Patterns of tree mortality in a temperate deciduous forest derived from a large forest dynamics plot. Ecosphere, 7(12). doi:10.1002/ecs2.1595

Description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: woody stem component (ANPP_woody_stem)
Parameters / Conditions: Vegetation/crop type/subtype: Trees, broadleaf, deciduous or with dominant deciduous component; Species: Dominant canopy trees include tulip poplar (Liriodendron tulipifera), pignut, red and mockernut hickory (Carya glabra, C. ovalis and C. tomentosa), black gum (Nyssa sylvatica), white ash (Fraxinus americana), white and red oak (Quercus alba, Q. rubra), slippery elm (Ulmus rubra), and American beech (Fagus grandifolia). Prominent understory components include spicebush (Lindera benzoin), pawpaw (Asimina triloba), American hornbeam (Carpinus caroliniana), witchhazel (Hamamelis virginiana), eastern redbud (Cercis canadensis), flowering dogwood (Cornus florida), blackhaw (Viburnum prunifolium), and common serviceberry (Amelanchier arborea); Biomass attributes/age: dbh trees >= 1 cm/108 yrs; Soil type/nutrient content: Alfisol.
Region / Regional Conditions: Spatial boundaries: North America, United States of America, Virginia, Front Royal (geographic coordinates: 38.8935, -78.14539); Climate: ; Ecological zone: Temperate mountain system; Temperature: mean annual temperature 12.9 degrees C; Moisture: annual precipitation: 1001 mm yr-1
Other properties: ForC site: Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute CTFS-ForestGEO plot (ID#: 1698); ForC plot: 25.6-ha forest dynamics plot (ID#: 2227); ForC measurement ID: 30693; Date of Measurement: 2008.4-2013.4; plot size: 25.6 ha; disturbance type: No severe disturbance since 1973; variable description: Annual aboveground woody production accounting for stem growth but not branch fall; i.e., wood (including branch) increment determined using allometric equations relating aboveground woody biomass increment to changes in stem diameter of all individual trees in the plot. Also known as "coarse woody productivity".; elevation: 302 m; Koeppen climate zone: Cfa.
Technical Reference: Helcoski, R., Tepley, A. J., Pederson, N., McGarvey, J. C., Meakem, V., Herrmann, V., ... Anderson-Teixeira, K. J. (2019).
